I don‚Äôt even think it gets too difficult too quickly, but the fact that you have to start from the first round of the level whenever you die is just, not fun. Seriously... I work for a software company, and it would be a quick easy code modification to change that behavior.

title.label: Love this game but won‚Äôt work on my iPhone X

content.label: this game is just outstanding I love how they made it look like a arcade game, has a great storyline, and the music is amazing. And don't worry about money! It's worth it because it has a ton of levels the music is AMAZING!!!!!!!!! And all I have to say now is bye and have a great time playing it! (If your interested) üëå

The concept is good and the game is fun to play, but the difficulty ramp is way too steep from stage 1 to stage 2. Case in point, the first couple jumps in 2-1 are borderline impossible, and there are still 4 levels after that.

Secondly, there are still too many screen flashes when the "screen flashes" setting is turned off. It's especially bad when you have to restart levels so frequently because of the difficulty.

Third, having to beat 5 levels in a row to advance is fine on easier stages, but gets old very quickly in stage 2 when the difficulty spikes. So much of the game relies on precise timing and muscle memory, but it's unnecessarily hard to practice later levels in a set when it takes so many tries just to reach them between runs. A practice mode would solve this problem, allowing players to become good at levels individually, but still requiring all 5 to be completed in one go to advance.

Ultimately it still has a lot of potential, but slowing it down over all would broaden the audience. The levels are complicated enough to still be difficult while not requiring absolute perfection just to advance. Unfortunately, the extreme difficulty and nauseating screen flashes hold back what could be a great title.

With a pounding electronic soundtrack, plenty of levels, and incredibly satisfying drag-release action, this game is not for the faint of heart, but it is definitely worth two bucks. Incredible. Hats off to the guys at Laser Dog.
Hours and hours of fun for everyone easy to learn controls and cool graphics. :)

I love this game and think it is at it's fullest potential. If you saw comments saying that the levels in stage 2 were hard I beat them and I'm not a extremely good gamer. And if you think stage 2 was hard I'm on stage 3 and it has a flying virus that chases you! There are 5 worlds and 2 bonus levels for each world. Each world has 10 levels, each level has 5 stages. If you die in the middle of a level you will be sent back to stage 1 of that level. I love this game and highly recommend it.

title.label: A New Era Of Platforming for iOS

content.label: This game is addictive, in the best way possible. It's a very different Platformer, and that's what makes it fun and unique! This game is great for long car rides, and just fun to play sitting on the couch at home. The only thing that needs to be added is a pause button, that also lets you return back to the level select. I don't know if that was an error, or if it's just not in the game, but it would be really handy if that was added!
Terrible controls very unuser friendly

Neat concept and game, but making the player redo from the 1st level on each section when dying is just annoying. Should start from where you died. Gave it 3 stars due to this annoying aspect of the game üòû

Loved this game. Gameplay is addicting, rewarding, and fun. People who complain about it being too hard or touchy just aren‚Äôt the focused-gamer sort. I‚Äôve now played this through twice, gathering every time and collection achievement possible (not hardcore... yet). With some persistence you can master these levels, and there‚Äôs nothing like the feeling of completing a level in the fastest time.

I did notice a few drawbacks: Playing for a bit when near the end of battery life introduces an inhibiting lagginess in the gameplay. This could be a device limitation in general‚Äînot necessarily the dev‚Äôs bad. The end of stage 5-10 forces you to use the back-out button to finish after the credits, which voids your time achievement if you got it. If you‚Äôre a completionist like me you see this as some kind of really sadistic joke, but I pray it‚Äôs just a dev mistake. There‚Äôs a weird jumbled lock in the top right corner of the stage-5 selection screen that‚Äôs either a really weird glitch-style easter egg for stage 6 (please-oh-please) or just a real glitch (üôÑ). I noticed a few times when my finger did a really weird twitchy loop I was able to jump somewhat backward *through* the platform I was jumping from. I‚Äôm not insane or I might have tried to master this to exploit the harder levels for top times. That said, there are *definitely* level hacks that allow you to finish in record time with big shortcuts. Don‚Äôt know if you‚Äôre supposed to be rewarded for thinking outside the box or if the beta testers just missed some fringe cases, but it‚Äôs worth noting that several of the top finishers used these exploits to gain ranking.

I noticed that the Game Center tracks progress now. Last time I reinstalled that either wasn‚Äôt the case or it didn‚Äôt preserve my completion progress. That experience makes me scared to uninstall to test it.

Recap, though: rough around the edges, but it‚Äôs got it where it counts. This is definitely one of my favorite apps of all time. 5 stars not because it‚Äôs 100% perfect, but because it‚Äôs so dang enjoyable anyway. Also, I read a review of someone saying the soundtrack was annoying. That person should be drawn & quartered. This soundtrack is $&!#‚Äôing amazing.

This app. So good.
Makes for a game I played 5 minutes and then removed from my phone.
This game is so much fun. It challenges you to beat sets of 5 levels in a certain amount of time. I feel like I'm playing a PC game because of how we'll it plays.

This game is really great. 8bit graphics, Great music, but when you play through those levels, you want to make your own. I mean, who doesn't like to play their friend's levels? It'll boost your sales, and people will love it. Also, have a feature where you can just tap to go somewhere. It's kind of hard to drag in a wide area if you're on an iPhone with a small screen. Great game, Just needs Level editor, different controls, WHAT DOES HQ MEAN???, achievements, multiplayer, I could keep on listing. What I'm trying to say is, this game has a lot (LOT) of potential. This is worth the money. (Make portals)
Countless reviews point these out. This game would be great if it weren't for these bugs. Game concept: B+. Execution: F.

title.label: Its fun until you get to stage 2.

content.label: Stage 1 was a little hard but fun. But when you get to stage 2 is when the game reveals its flaws to you like already mentioned. It's so hard to ace any level that I stopped caring about acing anything. Often when you swipe at an angle that is suppose to get you to the next platform, your character decides to fly at a complete different angle which is frustrating and a little stressful. But the maximum stress comes in when you complete a really hard round after many fails, and then the next round is even harder, then you fail epically in that harder round THEN you are forced to redo the ENTIRE LEVEL AGAIN!! Including that first hard round with absolutely no way to skip a round.....I am now officially against this concept. So whatever game that has this system instant denial from me. That is excruciating stressful, and I'm trying to avoid stressful games right now. Love the tracks though lol.

I got it when it was the featured free app, but if you're considering buying it, you don't have to worry about the amount of content not being worth the money as there are a lot of levels (there are five stages, each stage has ten runs, each run has five different levels within it, and there are two bonus games you can unlock with each stage). And it's definitely not easy, so prepare to die over and over. You must get through the five levels within each run without dying, or you have to start the run all over again, which makes it both thrilling and frustrating. Sometimes you have to move super fast, or new obstacles are introduced without explanation, which also requires dying and learning from your mistakes. If a run is difficult, you just have to play it over and over and you'll eventually get better at it. I had some problems with the character not moving in the direction I swiped, but that was only a few of the levels. It can be hard on the levels where it's zoomed out and hard to see the character.  I love the variety of color designs for the runs, the replay video feature (which is very helpful in figuring out a level, or just to review your awesome skills), and the bonus level you get from collecting all the gameboys (wish they were easier to unlock!).

Remove or radically speed up the level "load in" animation. I have died 30+ times just because my first swipe was canceled. 

Sometimes it seems as if the game adjusted my swipe, not too sure if that's the case.
  
When I swipe left, I expect to go left, not some weird diagonal angle. 

You may say: "take your time and aim"

To that I say: "the platform I was standing on exploded!"

The controls definitely need tweaking, adding a tap mode might fix the control scheme. 

At high levels, because of the controls, the game becomes frustratingly difficult when trying to 100%. To the point where I went out of my way to write this review. 

The game at its core is a good game and you did a great job on it, but the controls are lacking for high level play. 

iPhone 6S

Really, graphics, sound track, game play all fun, but it gets way too hard way too fast.  And the play 5 levels to win one gets old really really fast.
You guys have a fantastic game here. Just make it playable and stop the repeat 5 levels every time you die.
Glad I didn't have to pay for it...

title.label: Best Free Game On The App Store

content.label: Amazing game, that gets even better once you get the hang of it and can do it fast. Amazing soundtrack, and the satisfaction of speed running a level is intense. Only downside is theres only 10 levels, but if there were more i would gladly pay for it.. GREAT GAME

Each level has 5 sections. When you die you have to start over at the beginning of the level.  So, for example, if you die on 5/5, you have to start over on 1/5. This makes the game very tedious. If you could start over at the beginning of a section it would be a good game. Unfortunately you cannot.

Bringing back a lil nostalgia with the 8bit graphics for the older kids. What's nice is that you might be able to beat a level, but did you master it? The levels are timed and the challenge is getting the times down of how long it takes to complete them. Pretty simple, in graphics, and gameplay, but definitely a nice game to fill in the time riding the bus, the elevator, or while the old lady is beaching at ya. It's helped me cut down on my drinking too!
